III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following area:
• Training- The agency was advised to ensure their orientation and annual
training documentation specifically details all items required in rule 209-2.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.

Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during
this licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
The interim inspection was completed on 8/22/24, with a CAP approved on 9/9/24.
The agency had violations regarding borrowed bed documentation. The Chief
Administrator reported the CAP was successfully implemented. There were no
repeat violations found during this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment (CAA) dated 6/24/25 was reviewed and
discussed on-site. The CAA indicated the 2024 CAP was implemented
successfully through an adjustment in the agency’s borrowed bed process. In
addition, the agency continues to review monthly management reports, meet with
staff for monthly supervision, and check the Book of Business weekly to ensure
timelines are met for case management activities. The CAA reported the agency
continues to score high in all Key Performance Indicators. The chief administrator
reported cases have been low during this review period due to changes in staffing.
However, it seems staffing is now stable, and they anticipate taking more cases
and developing more foster homes in the coming months. The CAA indicated
there were no disruptions or unplanned moves during this review period.
Financial Overview
The 2025 budget was reviewed on-site. No concerns were noted. The agency is
still awaiting the completion of their 2024 financial assessment. The Chief
Administrator reported she had frequent contact with the accountant and expected
the assessment to be completed soon. The assessment will be provided to DCWL
upon completion.
Staff Interviews
Two staff were interviewed on-site. Both staff were relatively new to the agency.
Both staff reported they enjoyed their work, even though it could be difficult at
times. One staff member stated they had great teamwork at their office, which was
helpful when cases could be difficult. Both staff said they felt supported and could
talk to their supervisor about anything, as she was easy to talk to and very
knowledgeable. Both staff stated the agency was wonderful to work for and they
did not have any suggestions for improvement.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency continues to be located in the same office building as the 2024
review. The office has sufficient space for staff to work and meet with clients.
There is room for families to visit or attend trainings and meetings. There is
sufficient office equipment and supplies, as well as locking storage for files and
confidential documents. All files were stored securely, and a cross shredder was
on-site for CHRI.

VII. AGENCY ANALYST FINDINGS
There were no identified safety concerns.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
